title: Replaced Direct Console Calls with Wrappers
details:
BUG FIX: Direct console.log() Bypassing Filter System (v1.6.0.9)

ROOT CAUSE:
30+ direct console.log() calls throughout codebase bypassed the filter system completely. Categories included:
- Hover events (mouseover/mouseout)
- URL Detection (all phases)
- Keyboard shortcuts (event, matching, execution)
- Clipboard operations (copy URL, copy text, fallback)

SOLUTION:
Systematically replaced all direct console calls with logging wrapper functions from logger.js.

FILES UPDATED:
1. src/content.js - 12 replacements
   - console.log('[Hover]...') → logNormal('hover', 'Start', ...)
   - console.log('[URL Detection]...') → logNormal('url-detection', 'Success', ...)
   - console.log('[Keyboard]...') → logNormal('keyboard', 'Event', ...)
   - console.log('[Clipboard]...') → logNormal('clipboard', 'Action', ...)

2. src/features/url-handlers/index.js - 6 replacements
   - All URL detection logging converted to logNormal('url-detection', ...)

3. src/core/browser-api.js - 8 replacements
   - Clipboard API logging converted to logNormal/logError('clipboard', ...)

PATTERN:
Old: console.log('[Category] [Action] Message', {context, timestamp: Date.now()})
New: logNormal('category', 'Action', 'Message', {context})

Benefits:
- Removed timestamp duplication (wrapper adds it)
- Consistent formatting across all logs
- All logs now respect filter settings
- Proper category-based filtering works
